full_text.full_text:
k-Nearest Neighbor Classifiers (1/2)
▪ Consider each instance (x, y) as a point in a d-dimensional space
– x = (x1, x2, …, xd): the values of d attributes
– y: the class label of the instance
▪ Given a new instance x, compute its distance to each of the 
training instances (x, y), i.e., dist(x, x)
– According to one of the proximity measures described before
– (ex) Euclidean distance, Manhattan distance, Cosine distance, …
▪ Find the k training instances closest to x
– We call those instances the k-nearest neighbors
10

text.text: ▪ Consider each instance (x, y) as a point in a d-dimensional space

– x = (x1, x2, …, xd): the values of d attributes
– y: the class label of the instance

▪ Given a new instance x, compute its distance to each of the 
training instances (x, y), i.e., dist(x, x)

– According to one of the proximity measures described before
– (ex) Euclidean distance, Manhattan distance, Cosine distance, …
▪ Find the k training instances closest to x
– We call those instances the k-nearest neighbors
